original: de gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad de /

original: de dus dus sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil ma'i snod de'o //
analyzed: de dus dus sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil ma'i snod de'o //

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag de lta bas na tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga la dge slong rnams gcig tu 'dus te chos smra bar bya ba rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag de lta bas na tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga la dge slong rnams gcig tu 'dus te chos smra bar bya ba rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, ‚ÄúMonks, therefore, I allow you to gather together on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of the month and recite the Dharma.‚Äù

original: nad pas de ma byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pas de ma byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /

original: nad pas chos mnyan pa de ma mnyan pa dang ma bton pa la nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nad pas chos mnyan pa de ma mnyan pa dang ma bton pa la nyes pa med pa'o //

original: de smra ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa mi mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de smra ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa mi mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: chos de bstan pa dang gdon pa smra ba'i phyir gzhan gsol ba 'debs pa ni dge slong gis mi mnod par mi bya ste /

original: khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: mi nus pa la sogs pa yin na gsol ba 'debs pa la shad kyis spyad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: If one is sick and unable to teach, or if one is busy with other duties, one should explain the situation to the one who requests the teaching, is the meaning.

analyzed: smra ba po med na rim gyis dran par bya zhing than tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang smra par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gal te chos smra ba po med par dge slong thams cad rga na rims kyis dran par bya zhing tha na tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang gdon par bya ba'o //

original: der mar me gzugs so zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa der ro //
analyzed: der mar me gzugs so zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa der ro //

original: khyams su chos nyan pa'i gral zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu 'am rdzing bu'i rnam pa lta bur bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyams su chos nyan pa'i gral zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu 'am rdzing bu'i rnam pa lta bur bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gnas ngos bzhi kun nas steng gi khyams btags pa'i nang du chos nyan pa'i gral zla gam lta bu'am gru bzhir bsham par bya ba'o //

original: de yang dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de yang dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: This is merely an example.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi gnod pa gzhan dag kyang rung bas nges pa med do //üîΩbla gab med par chos mnyan na bla re @120b gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi gnod pa gzhan dag kyang rung bas nges pa med do // bla gab med par chos mnyan na bla re @120b gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no certainty, because other things that are pleasing and not harmful are also suitable.üîΩ If the Dharma is listened to in the open air, a canopy should be erected.

original: gal te bla gab med par chos nyan na bla re gdags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bla gab med par chos nyan na bla re gdags par bya ba'o //

analyzed: rlung dang chang 'bab na brtul lo zhes bya ba ni bla re'o //

original: der gnas brtan dang por 'dug ste yud tsam zhig cang mi smra bar bsdad nas chos smra bar bya ba 'am gzhan la dge slong chos smros shig ces gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The elder should sit down first in the place where the Dharma is taught, and after sitting in silence for a while, he should either teach the Dharma himself or request someone else to teach the Dharma, saying, ‚ÄúO monk, please teach the Dharma.‚Äù

analyzed: chos smra ba'i gnas der gnas brtan dang por 'dug ste dus cung zhig cang mi smra bar bsdad nas /

analyzed: gal te chos yin na spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: chos smra ba po chos smra ba na thams cad kyis sems gtad par bya'o //

analyzed: gal te ma yin na bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: sems dma' ba zhes bya ba ni rgyags pa dad nga rgyal nges par bcom pa nyid kyis so //

analyzed: gus par bcas te bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: In order to demonstrate the respect, he says, with respect for the Dharma, with steadfastness, with an undistracted mind, with appropriate and liberating words.üîΩWith respect for the Dharma means

analyzed: ma 'dres par ro zhes bya ba ni gtam gzhan dag dang ma 'dres par ro //

analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so zhes bya ba ni /

translated: With a mind of compassion means

translated: with a mind free of material desires.

analyzed: rangs pa dang mos pa dang dga' bar byed pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: He delights, inspires confidence, and gladdens.

translated: He delights by teaching the Dharma in order to remove the discouragement of those who are listening.üîΩHe inspires confidence by teaching the Dharma in order to counteract the lack of faith of those who have no faith.

analyzed: dga' bar byed pas so zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par byed pa nyid kyi gnyen por dga' bar byed cing chos bstan par bya ba'o //

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
